entry.summary: Professor Tim Jamison’s company Snapdragon Chemistry helps turn the latest innovations in chemistry into impactful drugs.

entry.title: Using computational tools for molecule discovery
entry.summary: Assistant professor Connor Coley is developing tools that would be able to predict molecular behavior and learn from both successes and mistakes.

entry.title: Unleashing capacity at Heineken México with systems thinking from MIT
entry.summary: How a pair of MIT Sloan Executive Education alumni translated teachings from an MIT course to operations improvements at Mexico’s largest brewery.

entry.title: Tiny particles power chemical reactions
entry.summary: A new material made from carbon nanotubes can generate electricity by scavenging energy from its environment.

entry.summary: Math professor Ankur Moitra seeks algorithms with provable guarantees, to pin down the mechanisms of machine learning.

entry.title: Exploring the future of humanitarian technology
entry.summary: Technology solutions to climate change, disaster response, and global health challenges are up for discussion in a new Lincoln Laboratory lecture series.

entry.title: Engineers create a programmable fiber
entry.summary: In a first, the digital fiber contains memory, temperature sensors, and a trained neural network program for inferring physical activity.

entry.title: Accelerating AI at the speed of light
entry.summary: Yichen Shen PhD '16 is CEO of Lightelligence, an MIT spinout using photonics to reinvent computing for artificial intelligence.

entry.title: The potential of artificial intelligence to bring equity in health care
entry.summary: Nearly 1,400 joined the AI for Health Care Equity Conference that explored new AI technologies as a platform for change.

entry.title: Artificial intelligence system could help counter the spread of disinformation
entry.summary: Built at MIT Lincoln Laboratory, the RIO program automatically detects and analyzes social media accounts that spread disinformation across a network.

entry.title: New algorithms show accuracy, reliability in gauging unconsciousness under general anesthesia
entry.summary: Machine learning software advances could help anesthesiologists optimize drug dose.

author.name: David Orenstein | Picower Institute for Learning and Memory

entry.title: v1.9.0
entry.summary:
Added: experimental support for iTunes podcast feed: Demo | Source. With this new release, you can render an audio control to play the mp3 file and display iTunes episode duration. It is "experimental" due to these caveats:
This feature is currently only available through custom template. iTunes has no strict format requirement for duration. The unit is most likely seconds but can be "hh:mm:ss" or "mm:ss" for some sources. A future version may expose a human readable string to the template. No image support yet. Some shows might have disabled CORS or use a relative URL for image, which forces osmosfeed to download the image during build. A future version may support it. You can't republish the podcast in the feed output. Supporting this goes beyond the scope of the project at the moment. Fixed: the articles in template data were not sorted. Thank you @Zenigata

entry.title: Slender robotic finger senses buried items
entry.summary: The technology uses tactile sensing to identify objects underground, and might one day help disarm land mines or inspect cables.

entry.title: v1.8.1
entry.summary: Fixed: UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: At least one option must be a string

entry.title: v1.8.0
entry.summary: Changed: Smart summary truncation. When there is no dedicated summary (only Atom feed has it, and many sites don't use it) from the source, we check if the content/description (Both Atom and RSS) field is long enough to be full text. If so, it will be truncated into a "pseudo" summary. If not, we assume the source used the content field as summary, and it will be displayed in full length. Thank you: @LooperXX.

entry.title: There’s a symphony in the antibody protein the body makes to neutralize the coronavirus
entry.summary: Professor Markus Buehler composed it, and a South Korean orchestra performed it; it’s the latest in a series of artistic collaborations sparked by Buehler’s exploration of the structure of SARS-CoV-2.

author.name: Kim Martineau | MIT Quest for Intelligence

entry.title: Jeremy Kepner named SIAM Fellow
entry.summary: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics recognizes Kepner, a pivotal member of the team that established Lincoln Laboratory's Supercomputing Center, for his innovative work in computing.

entry.title: Behind Covid-19 vaccine development
entry.summary: A machine learning model developed jointly by Janssen and MIT data scientists played a key role in the clinical trial process for the Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine.

entry.title: v1.7.2
entry.summary: ⚠ Deprecated: To accommodate the monorepo setup, the node version in all templates/demos/examples has changed from 14 to 16. This is not a breaking change as our compile target is still node 14, and node 16 is backward compatible. We still recommend you start using node-version: "16" in your .github/workflows/update-feed.yaml today to get the performance/security improvements from the newer node. See example Chore: Reorganize to monorepo with npm workspace.

entry.title: v1.7.1
entry.summary: Fixed: static files were unnecessarily copied for custom templates.

entry.title: v1.7.0
entry.summary: Added: templating system. Demo | Source | Docs Chore: rendering logic refactoring. Adopting functional paradigm. Thank you @tianheg, @onnyyonn
